intro: Chrysosplenium naminoense, commonly known as the Naminoen spleenwort, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Spleeniaceae. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
